input: Each State Party undertakes not to transfer to any recipient whatsoever nuclear weapons or other nuclear explosive devices or control over such weapons or explosive devices directly, or indirectly; and not in any way to assist, encourage, or induce any non-nuclear-weapon State to manufacture or otherwise acquire nuclear weapons.
target: [{"type": "prohibition", "actor": "State Party", "action": "transfer nuclear weapons to any recipient"}, {"type": "prohibition", "actor": "State Party", "action": "assist or encourage non-nuclear-weapon State to acquire nuclear weapons"}]

input: Each non-nuclear-weapon State Party to the Treaty undertakes not to receive the transfer from any transferor whatsoever of nuclear weapons or other nuclear explosive devices or of control over such weapons or explosive devices directly, or indirectly; not to manufacture or otherwise acquire nuclear weapons; and not to seek or receive any assistance in the manufacture of nuclear weapons.
target: [{"type": "prohibition", "actor": "non-nuclear-weapon State Party", "action": "receive transfer of nuclear weapons"}, {"type": "prohibition", "actor": "non-nuclear-weapon State Party", "action": "manufacture or acquire nuclear weapons"}, {"type": "prohibition", "actor": "non-nuclear-weapon State Party", "action": "seek assistance in manufacturing nuclear weapons"}]

input: Each State Party undertakes never under any circumstances to develop, produce, stockpile or otherwise acquire or retain chemical weapons, or transfer, directly or indirectly, chemical weapons to anyone.
target: [{"type": "prohibition", "actor": "State Party", "action": "develop chemical weapons"}, {"type": "prohibition", "actor": "State Party", "action": "produce chemical weapons"}, {"type": "prohibition", "actor": "State Party", "action": "stockpile chemical weapons"}, {"type": "prohibition", "actor": "State Party", "action": "transfer chemical weapons"}]

input: Each State Party undertakes to destroy chemical weapons it owns or possesses, or that are located in any place under its jurisdiction or control, in accordance with the provisions of this Convention.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "State Party", "action": "destroy chemical weapons it owns or possesses"}]

input: Each State Party shall declare whether it owns or possesses any chemical weapons, or whether there are any chemical weapons located in any place under its jurisdiction or control.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "State Party", "action": "declare ownership or possession of chemical weapons"}]

input: The States Parties to this Convention, recognizing that the prohibition of biological and toxin weapons and their elimination would be a step towards general and complete disarmament, affirm their determination never to develop, produce, stockpile or otherwise acquire or retain biological agents or toxins.
target: [{"type": "prohibition", "actor": "States Parties", "action": "develop biological agents or toxins"}, {"type": "prohibition", "actor": "States Parties", "action": "produce biological agents or toxins"}, {"type": "prohibition", "actor": "States Parties", "action": "stockpile biological agents or toxins"}]

input: Each State Party shall submit to the Depositary a declaration identifying the location, aggregate quantity and detailed inventory of chemical weapons it owns or possesses, not later than 30 days after this Convention enters into force for it.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "State Party", "action": "submit declaration of chemical weapons location and inventory within 30 days"}]

input: With respect to customs duties and charges of any kind imposed on or in connection with importation or exportation, any advantage, favour, privilege or immunity granted by any contracting party to any product originating in any other country shall be accorded immediately and unconditionally to the like product originating in the territories of all other contracting parties.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "contracting party", "action": "accord most-favoured-nation treatment to products from all contracting parties"}]

input: The products of the territory of any contracting party imported into the territory of any other contracting party shall not be subject, directly or indirectly, to internal taxes or other internal charges of any kind in excess of those applied, directly or indirectly, to like domestic products.
target: [{"type": "prohibition", "actor": "contracting party", "action": "apply higher internal taxes to imported products than domestic products"}]

input: Members shall ensure that their laws, regulations and administrative procedures conform with the provisions of this Agreement. Each Member shall ensure that any measures related to intellectual property rights are transparent and are made available promptly.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "Members", "action": "ensure laws conform with the Agreement"}, {"type": "obligation", "actor": "Members", "action": "ensure intellectual property measures are transparent"}]

input: Each Party shall prepare, communicate and maintain successive nationally determined contributions that it intends to achieve. Parties shall pursue domestic mitigation measures, with the aim of achieving the objectives of such contributions.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "Party", "action": "prepare and communicate nationally determined contributions"}, {"type": "obligation", "actor": "Party", "action": "pursue domestic mitigation measures"}]

input: Developed country Parties shall provide financial resources to assist developing country Parties with respect to both mitigation and adaptation in continuation of their existing obligations under the Convention.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "Developed country Parties", "action": "provide financial resources to developing country Parties"}]

input: Each Party shall cooperate in taking appropriate measures to conserve and protect the marine environment from pollution and to promote the sustainable use of marine living resources.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "Party", "action": "cooperate in conserving marine environment"}, {"type": "obligation", "actor": "Party", "action": "protect marine environment from pollution"}]

input: Each Contracting Party shall, in accordance with its particular conditions and capabilities, develop national strategies for the conservation and sustainable use of biological diversity and integrate such conservation into relevant sectoral plans.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "Contracting Party", "action": "develop national strategies for conservation of biological diversity"}, {"type": "obligation", "actor": "Contracting Party", "action": "integrate conservation into sectoral plans"}]

input: Each State Party shall take effective legislative, administrative, judicial or other measures to prevent acts of torture in any territory under its jurisdiction. No exceptional circumstances whatsoever may be invoked as a justification of torture.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "State Party", "action": "take measures to prevent acts of torture"}, {"type": "prohibition", "actor": "State Party", "action": "invoke exceptional circumstances to justify torture"}]

input: No State Party shall expel, return or extradite a person to another State where there are substantial grounds for believing that he would be in danger of being subjected to torture.
target: [{"type": "prohibition", "actor": "State Party", "action": "expel or return person to state where they face torture"}]

input: Everyone has the right to freedom of thought, conscience and religion; this right includes freedom to change his religion or belief, and freedom to manifest his religion or belief in teaching, practice, worship and observance.
target: [{"type": "right", "actor": "everyone", "action": "freedom of thought, conscience and religion"}, {"type": "right", "actor": "everyone", "action": "change religion or belief"}, {"type": "right", "actor": "everyone", "action": "manifest religion in teaching, practice and worship"}]

input: The States Parties to the present Covenant recognize the right of everyone to education. They agree that education shall be directed to the full development of the human personality and shall strengthen respect for human rights.
target: [{"type": "right", "actor": "everyone", "action": "education"}, {"type": "obligation", "actor": "States Parties", "action": "ensure education develops human personality and respects human rights"}]

input: Providers of high-risk AI systems shall ensure that high-risk AI systems are designed and developed in such a way that they achieve an appropriate level of accuracy, robustness, and cybersecurity, and perform consistently throughout their lifecycle.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "Providers of high-risk AI systems", "action": "ensure AI systems achieve appropriate accuracy and robustness"}, {"type": "obligation", "actor": "Providers of high-risk AI systems", "action": "ensure AI systems have appropriate cybersecurity"}]

input: Providers of high-risk AI systems shall draw up the technical documentation before that system is placed on the market or put into service and shall keep that documentation up to date.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "Providers of high-risk AI systems", "action": "draw up technical documentation before market placement"}, {"type": "obligation", "actor": "Providers of high-risk AI systems", "action": "keep technical documentation up to date"}]

input: Member States should ensure transparency and explainability appropriate to the context. AI actors should be able to inform users when they are interacting with an AI system and should enable affected persons to understand and challenge AI-based decisions.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "Member States", "action": "ensure transparency and explainability of AI systems"}, {"type": "obligation", "actor": "AI actors", "action": "inform users when interacting with AI system"}, {"type": "right", "actor": "affected persons", "action": "understand and challenge AI-based decisions"}]

input: Each Party shall take appropriate legislative and administrative measures to ensure that any activity involving the release of genetically modified organisms shall be subject to prior authorization and assessment of potential adverse effects.
target: [{"type": "obligation", "actor": "Party", "action": "ensure GMO activities require prior authorization"}, {"type": "obligation", "actor": "Party", "action": "assess potential adverse effects of GMO releases"}]
